question_content.barrons:question: Which of the following best expresses the relationship of the first sentence to the rest of the paragraph?

barrons:choices.barrons:choice: Quotation from an authority followed by conflicting views

question_content.barrons:explanation:
Assertion followed by analysis.

The opening sentence asserts that Austen’s friends would not have suspected that she was an authoress. The remainder of the passage analyzes why Austen made little of her status as a writer. Thus, the relationship of the first sentence to the rest of the paragraph is that of an assertion followed by analysis.

Specific instance followed by generalizations is incorrect. What follows the opening sentence is an examination of the critical implications of Austen’s attitude towards her work. One would not describe such a detailed examination as generalizations.

Objective statement followed by personal opinion is incorrect. The author is not simply expressing a personal opinion. She is examining the critical implications of Austen’s attitude towards her work.

Quotation from an authority followed by conflicting views is incorrect. While the opening sentence quotes Egerton, he is not necessarily an authority, and the remainder of the passage fails to present conflicting views.

Challenge followed by debate is incorrect. The opening sentence is in no way a challenge.
